article:
'Oxidative deamination' is a form of deamination that generates oxoacids in
the liver.

The presence of nitrous acid can cause transition mutations, by converting
cytosine to uracil. Primarily occurs in the liver and
kidneys. [http://www.mun.ca/biochem/courses/3107/Topics/Mutations.html
Mutations & Mutagenesis ][http://www.newton.dep.anl.gov/newton/askasci/1993/chem/CHEM016.HTM
Molecules and cancer ]
